item.title: Week 0: Intro & Tolerancing
item.description: 01-18: Course introduction # Overview # This class focuses on three main components – manufacturing processes, dimensional tolerances, and design communication – and how they interact with one another. The class is made up of 9 modules: Fundamentals Subtractive manufacturing processes Additive manufacturing processes Forming processes Joining processes Graphical visualization techniques Metrology: measuring manufactured objects Geometric dimensioning and tolerancing The future of manufacturing Why manufacturing? # In 2018, U.

item.title: Week 2: Cutting-based Processes & Other Subtractive Processes
item.description: 02-01 Cutting-based Processes # Modeling of material cutting # Chips are created and separated from the work by plastic deformation, i.e. shearing, of the work. Sheer plane is created by the tool (teal segment) Throughout the shear plane, the shear stress must equal or exceed the shear strength of the work material for cutting to proceed. The value of the shear angle is not something that we directly control, but depends on several factors.
